posts.post_content:
This is the most melvin planeswalker to date
  
his fight ability works with his 2/2 wolf to flip him
  
his plus 1 sets up his minus one perfectly
  
his minus one fills your graveyard for his minus 3
  
his plus one lets the entire boost from his minus 3 trample over with the deathtouch.

posts.post_content: I like the front side. Wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves wolves. I don't like how fragile Garruk is once he's flipped. He's just so vulnerable to [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock) and [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate) and what have you. Granted, he can start throwing out the wolves and gaining loyalty from it, but I really don't like that downtime where's he's so easy to kill.

Posted By: MyrBattlecube (9/30/2011 9:45:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5/5  
  
+1 :: WOLF TOKEN WITH DEATH TOUCH FOR THE WIN! :D Death touch kills anything that fights it, no questions ask. If only wolves had more support.  
  
-1 :: Wolf token decks now rely a lot on the graveyard, sacrificing a creature activates Morbid effects (Common for Green cards and other cards like that.) as well as feeds the effect for Gravecaller effects (Group name for "For every creature in your Graveyard" effects). Although, he would have 2 Loyalty counters to begin with, so I do not think the -1 effect would be wise right off the bat.  
  
-3 :: At the most your going to have to wait for this is 1 turn because of his other forms "when it has 2 or less loyalty counters" effect. But pretty much game winning if you use the right way.
posts.html:
5/5

+1 :: WOLF TOKEN WITH DEATH TOUCH FOR THE WIN! :D Death touch kills anything that fights it, no questions ask. If only wolves had more support.

-1 :: Wolf token decks now rely a lot on the graveyard, sacrificing a creature activates Morbid effects (Common for Green cards and other cards like that.) as well as feeds the effect for Gravecaller effects (Group name for "For every creature in your Graveyard" effects). Although, he would have 2 Loyalty counters to begin with, so I do not think the -1 effect would be wise right off the bat.

-3 :: At the most your going to have to wait for this is 1 turn because of his other forms "when it has 2 or less loyalty counters" effect. But pretty much game winning if you use the right way.

posts.post_content:
First hybrid planewalker frame! First planeshifted hybrid frame as well!  
  
The type and title background is dark grey - not because he's black - but because hybrid cards have light gray background and thus planeshifted hybrid frames should use a dark gray background.  
  
Cool, if that's the sort of thing you're into.
posts.html:
First hybrid planewalker frame! First planeshifted hybrid frame as well!

The type and title background is dark grey - not because he's black - but because hybrid cards have light gray background and thus planeshifted hybrid frames should use a dark gray background.

Cool, if that's the sort of thing you're into.

posts.post_content:
This guy needs a Beauty and the Beast alter. This card. This...card....Vorthos has a field day every time he sees it. Survival of the Fittest, on the Cursed Beast Man, in Parallel Lives Worlld? Its...its...GAAHHH!! drawn by a Frenchie, too.
  
too much. overload.
  
In order to make room for more Walkers, I hope Garruk dies on Innistrad. I think his story is a GREAT one, I love the character, but the best thing you can really do with your best characters is to grant them Epic Death Scenes and a Curtain Bow to thunderous applause. In cases like Jace TMS, however, rather than granting him the honor of an on-stage death scene, you should instead de-power him or just stop writing about him. Looks like Wizards went with de-powering so they can tell more Jace stories. That's fine. I don't think they can make Garruk's story any better though- it's so fantastic, I feel like it's really setting up a climactic finish with Liliana, probably right before Dark Ascension. (Which mark my words, will be... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

too much. overload.

posts.post_content:
"Once upon a time, in a faraway land, a young prince lived in a shining [castle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=castle). Although he had everything his heart desired, the prince was spoiled, selfish, and unkind.  
  
But then, one [Winter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Winter)'s [Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Night), an old beggar woman came to the [castle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=castle) and offered him a single Rose in return for shelter from the bitter [cold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cold).   
  
Repulsed by her haggard appearance, the prince sneered at the gift and turned the old woman away. But she warned him not to be deceived by appearances, for beauty is found within. And when he dismissed her again, the old woman's ugliness melted away to reveal a beautiful [Enchantress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchantress). The prince tried to apologize, but it was too late, for she had seen that there was no love in his heart. And as punishment, she transformed him into a [Hideous](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hideous) Beast and placed a powerful spell on the castle and all who lived there. Ashamed of his au... "Once upon a time, in a faraway land, a young prince lived in a shining castle. Although he had everything his heart desired, the prince was spoiled, selfish, and unkind.

But then, one Winter's Night, an old beggar woman came to the castle and offered him a single Rose in return for shelter from the bitter cold.

Repulsed by her haggard appearance, the prince sneered at the gift and turned the old woman away. But she warned him not to be deceived by appearances, for beauty is found within. And when he dismissed her again, the old woman's ugliness melted away to reveal a beautiful Enchantress. The prince tried to apologize, but it was too late, for she had seen that there was no love in his heart. Posted By: Arachnos (4/14/2012 3:36:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I love using this guy in a birthing pod/reanimation deck, it just goes overkill. If you're playing THG, it's easy to have your partner milling you out while you're using [reclaim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reclaim), [disemtomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=disemtomb), and other such cards. His tutor ability is great with the new Undying mechanic, bringing in stuff like [Strangleroot Geist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Strangleroot Geist) as a 3/2 haste for GG and still looking for another creature to beat the crap out of them. 5/5.
posts.html:
I love using this guy in a birthing pod/reanimation deck, it just goes overkill. If you're playing THG, it's easy to have your partner milling you out while you're using reclaim, disemtomb, and other such cards. His tutor ability is great with the new Undying mechanic, bringing in stuff like Strangleroot Geist as a 3/2 haste for GG and still looking for another creature to beat the crap out of them. 5/5.

posts.post_content:
I agree with Darth Parallax; Kiora Atua on Innistrad is unlikely. Mostly because one of the main selling points for this set is the world. Some radical new planeswalker would steal everyone's attention away from it. However Avacyn Restored is a large expansion, and will already be different from INN and DKA, so there's is still a dim possibility.  
  
Garruk is actually part black because he punches [puppies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=262872).
